name: ZAYTUNA COLLEGE
mission: Zaytuna College aims to educate and prepare morally committed professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders, who are grounded in the Islamic scholar...
programs: BA in Liberal and Islamic Studies
Center for Ethical Living and Learning (ZCELL)
theoryOfChange: By training the mind through the trivium and quadrivium alongside Islamic primary texts, the college produces leaders who can navigate modern society with moral and spiritual grounding.

evaluationSources: Accredited by WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC)

zakatClaimEvidence: Zaytuna College has a dedicated "Zakat Fund" which "serves as the basis of our financial aid program and is utilized to cover the total cost of educating a zakat-eligible student." Their donation page also lists "Zakat" as a designation option. Furthermore, Zaytuna College states, "Our current policy has been reviewed and approved by senior scholars, such as His Eminence, Shaykh Abdallah bin Bayyah, one of the foremost Muslim jurists of our time." (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFjZj9ls_cjqCGjOz6eZFuG61o14U90v849aIFKq70HibgYbOkoGffibqnMwxT3dACx93CKPa24x3a9jM9KOL-lyj1S_BLH_qG1d3w_b86pidZZRlpr8_6Xxu6IhR4d3IQD1T3U)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a capital deployment plan so very high reserves are intentionally used for mission delivery while preserving a prudent safety buffer.
components.name: Financial Health

components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: ZAYTUNA COLLEGE shows moderate impact and moderate alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Zaytuna College has a dedicated "Zakat Fund" which "serves as the basis of our financial aid program and is utilized to cover the total cost of educating a zakat-eligible student." Their donation page also lists "Zakat" as a designation option. Furthermore, Zaytuna College states, "Our current policy has been reviewed and approved by senior scholars, such as His Eminence, Shaykh Abdallah bin Bayyah, one of the foremost Muslim jurists of our time." (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFjZj9ls_cjqCGjOz6eZFuG61o14U90v849aIFKq70HibgYbOkoGffibqnMwxT3dACx93CKPa24x3a9jM9KOL-lyj1S_BLH_qG1d3w_b86pidZZRlpr8_6Xxu6IhR4d3IQD1T3U)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $18,359,667, a program expense ratio of 56.0%, and working capital of 33.6 months.
Financial data confirms the fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised and total revenue figures.
Zaytuna College is an accredited institution offering a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies.
The college provides a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts and maintains specific accreditation status.
The institution is zakat-eligible and accepts various forms of charitable giving.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Zaytuna College earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial health and unique educational niche, balanced by a program expense ratio that suggests significant overhead costs.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 56.0% is lower than the industry benchmark for highly efficient charities
Limited public data regarding specific long-term impact metrics for graduates

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows medium donor alignment as it addresses the urgent need for Islamic higher education in the West [3]. Its status as a zakat-eligible institution provides a specific fit for Muslim donors looking to support educational advancement [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The college demonstrates impact through capacity building by educating future communal leaders, supported by a total revenue of $18,359,667 [1][2]. While its program expense ratio is 56.0%, the institution maintains a robust financial position with 33.6 months of working capital to sustain its academic operations [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Zaytuna College serves as the first accredited Muslim liberal arts college in the United States, dedicated to grounding students in both Islamic and Western scholarly traditions.
strengths: High financial stability with 33.6 months of working capital
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1
Maintains formal accreditation for its unique liberal arts and Islamic studies curriculum
baseline_narrative.summary: Located in Berkeley, California, Zaytuna College offers specialized degree programs including a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts [3][4]. The institution operates as a zakat-eligible entity, focusing on preparing morally committed intellectual and spiritual leaders [8].
